intro: Clermontia × leptoclada, commonly known as the hybrid `leptoclada` clermonthe, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 3 meters, with opposite, ovate to elliptic leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in coastal and lowland forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
